topic: Melbourne Buddhist Monk Convicted of Child Sexual Abuse

ideas.title: The Guilty Verdict Mandala
ideas.premise: A courtroom is shown with a jury painstakingly arranging a mandala out of guilty verdicts, while the monk sweats profusely.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposes the beautiful/peaceful Mandala with the horrific guilty verdict.

ideas.title: The 'Enlighten'ment Program
ideas.premise: A brochure for the monk's 'Enlightenment Program' features increasingly alarming fine print about child safety protocols.
ideas.why_funny: Dark humour highlighting the contrast between spirituality and abuse.

ideas.title: Buddhists Get the Boot
ideas.premise: A sign at Flemington Racecourse reads 'Buddhists Not Permitted' next to a sign that reads 'Monaghan Fan Club Welcome'.
ideas.why_funny: Plays on the Melbourne Cup news item and absurdly equates Buddhist monks with potential race day misbehaviour.

ideas.title: Reincarnation Roulette
ideas.premise: The monk, facing the judge, says, 'Your Honour, I'm banking on reincarnation... hopefully, as a particularly angry wombat.'
ideas.why_funny: Uses the concept of reincarnation for dark comedic effect.

ideas.title: The Qantas 'Inner Peace' Flight
ideas.premise: A Qantas ad promising 'Inner Peace' to LA features a tiny disclaimer saying 'Not available to convicted Melbourne monks'.
ideas.why_funny: Using the Qantas Red Tail Sale news item for a dark, contextual joke.
